title: How to Make Organic Candy

steps.headline: Heat the oven to 200 degrees Fahrenheit (93 degrees Celsius).
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with an oven-safe silicone baking mat. Place the baking sheet in the oven and allow it to warm up.

steps.headline: Mix and heat the sugar, vinegar, and cranberry juice.
steps.description: Combine the three ingredients in a 2-qt (2-liter). Allow the ingredients to boil down into a syrup, reducing the heat once it actually begins to boil. Cook over medium-low for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Check the temperature of the syrup.
steps.description: It should be about 285 degrees Fahrenheit (140.6 degrees Celsius). Once the syrup reaches this temperature, you should remove of from the heat.

steps.headline: Add the peppermint extract.
steps.description: Mix the peppermint extract into the syrup quickly to make sure that it is thoroughly combined before the syrup begins to cool.

steps.headline: Remove the baking sheet from the oven.
steps.description: By now, it should be sufficiently warm.

steps.headline: Pour the syrup onto the silicone mat.
steps.description: You should pour the syrup into the center of the mat, rather than near the edges, and allow it to spread naturally.

steps.headline: Hold the edges of the mat.
steps.description: Fold the edges of the mat up to keep the syrup in a confined, narrow strip until it cools just enough to stop running.

steps.headline: Knead the syrup.
steps.description: Once it partially solidifies, begin pressing and folding the syrup in a kneading motion. Use the edges of your silicone mat or other non-stick utensils. Continue kneading for 25 minutes, until the syrup turns glossy.

steps.headline: Grease your hands.
steps.description: Spray nonstick cooking spray onto your hands to prevent your skin from sticking to the cooled candy.

steps.headline: Pull a small ball of candy from the main clump.
steps.description: The ball should be a little smaller than the size of a golf ball.

steps.headline: Stretch the candy.
steps.description: Pull the candy out, stretching it into a rope. Note that this process takes considerable strength and speed, and may work best if you have someone to help you.

steps.headline: Twist the rope.
steps.description: Bring the ends together and twist the halves of the rope together.

steps.headline: Form canes.
steps.description: Bend the top of the twisted rope into a hook or cane shape.

steps.headline: Allow the candy to cool.
steps.description: Place the finished canes on the silicone mat and harden at room temperature. Store the candy away from the sunlight.

steps.headline: Grease a baking sheet with the olive oil.
steps.description: Apply a thick coat of oil and cover the entire sheet to make sure that the candy will not stick.

steps.headline: Heat a cast iron skillet.
steps.description: Use medium-high heat, and continue heating the skillet until it the sides are hot to the touch.

steps.headline: Add the sesame seeds to the pan.
steps.description: Stir them with a wooden spoon until they turn golden brown. This process should take around four to six minutes to complete.

steps.headline: Add the honey and salt.
steps.description: Use a dash of salt or more, depending on your personal preferences. Stir the honey, salt, and sesame seeds until the mixture is thoroughly combined and stiff.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture onto the baking sheet.
steps.description: Use your wooden spoon to smooth it out and spread it over the entire baking sheet.

steps.headline: Cut the confection into pieces.
steps.description: Use a knife to score the mixture into 1/4-in. by 1-in. (2/3-cm by 1 1/2-cm) pieces while the mixture is still warm. Set the pan aside and allow the candy to cool.

steps.headline: Grease your hands with olive oil.
steps.description: You can also use nonstick cooking spray.

steps.headline: Peel the pieces from the pan once cool.
steps.description: The candy should be warm enough to work with, but cool enough to prevent burns. Roll the pieces into small logs.

steps.headline: Let to candy finish cooling at room temperature.
steps.description: When it has finished cooling, it will be fairly hard.

steps.headline: Fill a glass measuring cup with the coconut oil.
steps.description: The measuring cup must be heat-resistant.

steps.headline: Heat the measuring cup inside of a water-filled saucepan.
steps.description: Add a few inches (7 to 9 cm) of water to a small saucepan. Place the measuring cup inside, and heat the two together over medium heat until the coconut oil is warm and mostly melted.

steps.headline: Blend the ingredients together in a food processor.
steps.description: Pour the coconut oil into the food processor as well as the cocoa powder, coconut/palm sugar, salt, and vanilla. Process the ingredients together using a slow to medium speed until well combined.

steps.headline: Line a loaf pan with parchment paper.
steps.description: Plastic wrap will also work. Make sure that the bottom and sides of the pan are covered.

steps.headline: Pour the fudge mixture into the lined loaf pan.
steps.description: You may need to scrape it out using a rubber spatula. Use the spatula to smooth the fudge out evenly.

steps.headline: Wrap the fudge with the parchment paper.
steps.description: Fold the sides of the paper over the top of the fudge. Press down, gently, to even out the thickness.

steps.headline: Remove the fudge from the pan.
steps.description: Do not remove it from the parchment paper yet, however. Keep it wrapped in the parchment paper as it cools.

steps.headline: Freeze the fudge.
steps.description: Keep it in the freezer for about 20 to 30 minutes until it sets.

steps.headline: Cut the fudge into squares.
steps.description: Unwrap the fudge and use a sharp knife to cut small squares. You can get about one dozen moderately-sized squares from this, or you can get up to two dozen squares if you cut the fudge smaller.

Add a few inches (7 to 9 cm) of water to a small saucepan. Place the measuring cup inside, and heat the two together over medium heat until the coconut oil is warm and mostly melted.
